title: Schedule of Ratings - Cardiovascular System
description: Rating criteria for heart and vascular conditions

mets.description: Metabolic Equivalents - primary basis for rating most heart conditions
mets.testing: Exercise stress test (treadmill, bicycle) or interview-based assessment

examples.1_met: Eating, getting dressed, walking indoors around the house
examples.3_mets: Walking one to two blocks on level ground at 2-3 mph
examples.5_mets: Light yard work, mowing lawn, dancing
examples.7_mets: Carrying 60 pounds, heavy yard work, jogging

lvef.description: Left Ventricular Ejection Fraction - percentage of blood pumped per heartbeat

7000.name: Valvular heart disease (including rheumatic heart disease)

levels.criteria: Workload of greater than 7 METs but not greater than 10 METs results in dyspnea, fatigue, angina, dizziness, or syncope, or; continuous medication required

Workload of greater than 5 METs but not greater than 7 METs results in dyspnea, fatigue, angina, dizziness, or syncope, or; evidence of cardiac hypertrophy or dilatation on ECG, echocardiogram, or X-ray

More than one episode of acute congestive heart failure in past year, or; workload of greater than 3 METs but not greater than 5 METs results in dyspnea, fatigue, angina, dizziness, or syncope, or; left ventricular dysfunction with ejection fraction of 30-50%
Chronic congestive heart failure, or; workload of 3 METs or less results in dyspnea, fatigue, angina, dizziness, or syncope, or; left ventricular dysfunction with ejection fraction of less than 30%

7005.name: Arteriosclerotic heart disease (Coronary artery disease)

levels.criteria: Workload of greater than 7 METs but not greater than 10 METs results in dyspnea, fatigue, angina, dizziness, or syncope, or; continuous medication required

Workload of greater than 5 METs but not greater than 7 METs results in dyspnea, fatigue, angina, dizziness, or syncope, or; evidence of cardiac hypertrophy or dilatation on ECG, echocardiogram, or X-ray

More than one episode of acute congestive heart failure in past year, or; workload of greater than 3 METs but not greater than 5 METs results in dyspnea, fatigue, angina, dizziness, or syncope, or; left ventricular dysfunction with ejection fraction of 30-50%
Chronic congestive heart failure, or; workload of 3 METs or less results in dyspnea, fatigue, angina, dizziness, or syncope, or; left ventricular dysfunction with ejection fraction of less than 30%

7005.presumptive: Agent Orange presumptive condition (ischemic heart disease)

7006.name: Myocardial infarction
7006.special_rating: 100% for 3 months following MI, then rated on residuals

7010.name: Supraventricular arrhythmias

levels.criteria: Permanent atrial fibrillation (lone atrial fibrillation), or; one to four episodes per year of paroxysmal atrial fibrillation or other supraventricular tachycardia documented by ECG or Holter monitor
Paroxysmal atrial fibrillation or other supraventricular tachycardia, with more than four episodes per year documented by ECG or Holter monitor

7010.note: If there are associated cardiac symptoms, rate under appropriate code for underlying heart condition

levels.criteria: 1-4 episodes per year documented by ECG or Holter monitor
More than 4 episodes per year documented by ECG or Holter monitor
ICD (implantable cardioverter-defibrillator) required
Chronic congestive heart failure, or workload of 3 METs or less
Workload of greater than 7 METs but not greater than 10 METs
Workload of greater than 5 METs but not greater than 7 METs, or pacemaker required
Workload of greater than 3 METs but not greater than 5 METs
Workload of 3 METs or less, or chronic CHF, or LVEF less than 30%
For 1 year following transplant
Minimum rating thereafter, rate on residuals if greater

hypertension.name: Hypertensive vascular disease (hypertension and isolated systolic hypertension)

levels.criteria: Diastolic pressure predominantly 100 or more, or; systolic pressure predominantly 160 or more, or; minimum evaluation for an individual with a history of diastolic pressure predominantly 100 or more who requires continuous medication for control
Diastolic pressure predominantly 110 or more, or; systolic pressure predominantly 200 or more
Diastolic pressure predominantly 120 or more
Diastolic pressure predominantly 130 or more

hypertension.note: Hypertension is NOT the same as hypertensive heart disease (7007). Can have separate ratings if both conditions exist.
hypertension.presumptive: Agent Orange presumptive (as of 2021) and Camp Lejeune presumptive

levels.criteria: Claudication on walking more than 100 yards, and; diminished peripheral pulses or ankle/brachial index of 0.9 or less
Claudication on walking between 25 and 100 yards on a level grade at 2 mph, and; trophic changes (thin skin, absence of hair, dystrophic nails) or ankle/brachial index of 0.7 or less
Claudication on walking less than 25 yards on a level grade at 2 mph, and; trophic changes or ankle/brachial index of 0.5 or less
Ischemic limb pain at rest, and; deep ischemic ulcers or ankle/brachial index of 0.4 or less

important_rules: METs and LVEF are primary rating criteria
Ischemic heart disease is Agent Orange presumptive
100% for 3 months after MI, 1 year after transplant
Hypertension (7101) and hypertensive heart disease (7007) can be rated separately
